name: Shoot, Shield, Slash!
blurb: Thats the tagline and simplified thought process behind the video game that I'm developing.

rewards.reward: A "Thank You" plus a spot in the credits. Thank You!

Everything above plus an enemy token named after you (in a certain mode in the game, each defeated enemy will add a token to a gallery that gives a brief profile of the downed enemy. Basically a name, their "real" profession, and a funny blurb/thought/action/or something else random about them). I.E. Justin, 39 years old, Hates mustard in his lemonade, loves peanutbutter jammy time.

A digital copy of the game. This includes every platform that this game will be released on that will allow for free delivery. Most platforms will allow for free gifting/delivery like all of the PC platforms. If I need to buy the game to gift it to you then that platform isn't included.

Everything above plus access to a special portion of the forum that I will open up for the game once pre-development is completed and the project is funded. Your feedback will be considered more highly than others and will definitely help to influence what actually goes out. The forum will have access to a few significant posts or pieces of information first after the project is funded.

Everything above plus early access to propaganda (video footage, ads, posts, etc), demos, and the first stable beta for each platform. Your feedback will be considered more highly than others and will definitely help to influence what actually goes out.

Everything above plus a significant in-game character, boss, weapon, area, object or event being named after you. It may not be verbatim, but it will be significant. I.E. the Smithy Rusher, the Hannah Blast, the Bladed Cheriese, etc...

Everything above plus a deluxe copy of the game (physical disc(s) with install files/executables for every version of the game thats possible to install that way or sideload. Annotated source code, game assets, and early access to a debug/mod mode. Your copy of the game will have an easy way to access it for 1 month after the game releases. After that point the game will be updated to allow use for the mode for others.

Everything above plus a personally signed Fuzebox/Uzebox. I plan to order and sell a limited amount of these as part of marketing and interest rousing. The Uzebox is a completely open source console that competes with NES as far as horsepower goes. I'll be releasing a rom for it that will only feature an Arcade mode that pits the player in an endless swarm of enemies. It will have similar qualities to the main game that this project is for but it will be decidedly more primitive since once again it's going to be on an NES like system. It will have a mock history and lots of humor involved in its' presentation. If I can legally do so, I will include as many Uzebox roms as possible in the shipment of the device to anyone that pledges at this level. At the very least you can download them for free. I don't know of a single rom that's protected against free distribution but I will confirm this before shipping them out. Each Uzebox will come with 2 NES controllers and either a mini-disc or flash drive that has a back up of all of the roms on the system along with the the pc emulator and source code for the basic rom I'm creating and each pledgers customized rom file. This reward may take longer than all of the others to arrive due to availability of the system along with the extra time needed to develop the game. I'm already developing for multiple platforms but this one will require completely unique source code and cannot be started until the original game has become stable and is close to completion.
